head.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Yemen: Turnout Brisk For Competitive Presidential Election

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Middle East: Yemen: Turnout Brisk For Competitive Presidential Election

abstract.p: Yemen holds landmark election to choose president and local council representatives; turnout is high as Pres Ali Abdullah Saleh faces first serious challenge in 28 years in office (S)

block.p: Yemenis turned out in force for a landmark election to choose a president and local council representatives, and the nation's electoral commission extended voting by two hours. Lines of men and women stretched around the block at some polling places. Results of the presidential vote, in which President Ali Abdullah Saleh faced his first serious challenge after 28 years in office, must be released within 72 hours.
